description.narrative: Girls, boys, women and men in selected areas have increased understanding of violence and harmful practices that affect children especially girls, which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, boys, women and men in selected areas have increased understanding of violence and harmful practices that affect children especially girls

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support a nationwide inter-sectoral campaign dubbed "Ghanaians Against Child Abuse" that mobilises people to take action to end violence in Ghana. The campaign used different online and off-line tools to spread the message. The drive maintains a very active social media presence on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube. Social media platforms recorded over 12.9 million impressions (up from 5 million in 2018) since the start of the campaign in Nov 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes

baseline.value: National strategy or action plan approved by government with an operational plan and monitoring arrangements
